text: Argonia is a city in Sumner County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 456 people lived there. ==History== Argonia was created in 1881. It was named after the ship Argo in Greek mythology. In 1887, Susanna M. Salter became the first woman to win political office in United States history; she was elected Mayor of Argonia.Susanna Salter , Emily Taylor Centre, Retrieved 11 January 2017 ==Geography== Argonia is at (37.265299, -97.766123). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 456 people, 189 households, and 120 families living in Argonia. Of the households, 69.8% owned their home and 30.2% rented their home. The median age was 39.5 years. Of the people, 90.1% were White, 1.1% were Native American, 0.7% were Black, 0.7% were from some other race, and 7.5% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.5% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 501 people, 216 households, and 135 families living in Argonia. ==Education== Argonia is part of the Argonia USD 359 school district. ==Famous people== * Susanna M.
